alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 3:43AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 515 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over continuing over the east-southeast slopes of the Big Island. Heavy rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour in some areas and increasing in coverage as Tropical Storm Calvin passes south of the Big Island. A Flood Watch for the entire Big Island remains in effect. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Waikoloa Village, Kapaau, Honokaa, Pohakuloa Camp, Pohakuloa Training Area, Volcano, Glenwood, Mountain View, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Papaikou, Honomu, Pepeekeo, Keaau, Hawaiian Acres, Wood Valley, Laupahoehoe and Hakalau. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 515 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
